summary: This document is a chain of emails from June 2019 between FBI personnel and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) regarding victim notification procedures in anticipation of Jeffrey Epstein's arrest. It discusses compiling a list of 31 identified victims, challenges with contact information, and coordination for victim rights notifications.

persons.name: Sean Watson
persons.context: Mentioned as someone to whom victim information should not be sent; appears to be part of the FBI team handling the case.

persons.name: Olsen
persons.context: Discussed the case and victim notification procedures with FBI personnel; part of the SDNY team coordinating victim outreach.

connections.description: Both are involved in the victim notification process for the Epstein case, with Olsen coordinating from the SDNY and Watson being part of the FBI team.

events.title: Coordination for Epstein Arrest
events.description: Email discussions between FBI and SDNY regarding preparation for an upcoming arrest of Jeffrey Epstein, focusing on victim notification procedures.

events.title: Victim List Compilation
events.description: An FBI email notes there are 31 names of victims identified, with most lacking contact information and some declining interviews or being advised by attorneys not to discuss the case.

keyFacts: 31 victims had been identified by the FBI in the Epstein case as of June 2019.
Most identified victims had no contact information, and some had declined interviews or were advised by attorneys not to discuss the case.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) was preparing for Epstein's arrest and planning a press release with an 800 number for victims to self-identify.
Coordination between the FBI and SDNY was focused on ensuring victim notification complied with federal law, including entering victim information into the Victim Notification System (VNS).
The emails highlight the procedural challenges in contacting and notifying victims in a high-profile case.
